page.title: 15Education.
page.content: As in most places in the British Isles there has been a vast expansion of numbers of children in schools,which has now,and continues,to grow smaller.There are eight junior schools in our survey area including one Roman Catholic and two private. These in turn send their pupils to two main comprehensive schools and again there are three private schools in our survey area. The sixth form college which originated as a 'poor' school in the last century,has this year amalgamated with the local Technical College forming one new Tertiary College. Two of the comprehensive schools are designated community schools and their facilities are very well used by the populace.
